samples.question: What kind of misunderstandings could happen between parents and children?
samples.transcript: Of course, we have to be careful with the way that we manage our time because we know that we cannot speak forever and ever and ever. And these topics do have the scope to talk about them forever and ever and ever. And so we have to be careful what we do. But I I do think maybe a concrete example could be helpful.
samples.transcript_original: Of course, we have to be careful with the way that we manage our time because we know that we can't speak forever and ever and ever. And these topics do have the scope to talk about them forever and ever and ever. And so we have to be careful what we do. But I I do think maybe a concrete example could be helpful.

And these topics do have the scope to talk about them forever and ever and ever. And so we have to be careful what we do. But I I do think maybe a concrete example could be helpful.

samples.question: That is why it is hard to >> And do you think it is always easy for a person to apologize if they understand they have done something wrong?
samples.transcript: So certainly with higher level candidates, I like to dig deeper into what they say. So of course I have a list of questions but I tried to get those questions in in a way that feels like it is a discussion. So the candidate has said that people find it difficult to apologize because they cannot accept that they have done something wrong.
samples.transcript_original: So certainly with higher level candidates, I like to dig deeper into what they say. So of course I have a list of questions but I tried to get those questions in in a way that feels like it's a discussion. So the candidate has said that people find it difficult to apologize because they can't accept that they've done something wrong.

samples.question: Whereas maybe the best approach to say maybe the best approach or a better approach would be to be honest and say how do we show politeness?
samples.transcript: I do not know if there is anything specific about like my country. Of course, we say like please and thank you and and things like this and we apologize if we do something wrong, but I do not know.
samples.transcript_original: Um I don't know if there's anything specific about like my country. Of course, we say like please and thank you and and things like this and we apologize if we do something wrong, but uh I don't know.
samples.transcript_cleaned: I do not know if there is anything specific about like my country. Of course, we say like please and thank you and and things like this and we apologize if we do something wrong, but I do not know.

samples.question: I mean, how how do we show politeness to people?
samples.transcript: I am not sure. I think like other cultures, we we try to show respect to older people. So, we do this in a number of ways. Like sometimes we might, you know, chat to them on the street and make small talk with them or something like this. You know, old people sometimes they feel lonely and they want someone to speak to. So if you are on the bus with them, you might talk about the weather or something like this. That might feel like a bit more of a natural approach rather than just listing. So a couple of a couple of ways, a couple of strategies there. First, in order to avoid listing, we can, you know, list one or two or maybe up to three things and then go into detail or we can talk through our uncertainty or talk through our difficulty with a question. Nothing wrong with doing that.

samples.question: >> And how do you think ideas about politeness might change in the future?

samples.question: The key question is, can she hold it together on test day?
samples.transcript: She certainly, you know, she has all of the skills.
samples.transcript_original: She certainly, you know, she has all of the skills.
samples.transcript_cleaned: She certainly, you know, she has all of the skills.

samples.question: It is a test, right?
samples.transcript: If you have ever had a driving test or a job interview, you you probably come out of those things thinking like, "damn it. I I did not I did not do as well as I know I can do." And it is the same with the IELTS test that we always feel like I could have done better. I should have done better. I should not have said that. I should have said this, I should not have done that, I should have done this. it is a test. we and it always happens unfortunately. so yeah, in terms of language ability, the candidate certainly can get a nine. it is just a question of whether she can hold it together on test day. I I do not know if she is planning to take another IELTS test soon. I know she is done some IELTS tests in the past. I would say, you know, on the one hand, I would say forget about the nine. You do not need the nine. You do not need to prove anything to anyone. you you have mastered the English language. does not make any difference whether you get a nine or not. But I know if I was in her position as also an an uber competitive person, if I knew I could get the nine, I would want that nine. And so I can understand if the candidate wants to wants to go down that road of getting the nine. Examiners generally if they can avoid giving a nine, they prefer to give 8.5s. but yeah, an amazing performance. Very very well done. 8.5. The candidate is at C2 level for me. But you let me know what you think.

samples.question: Do you prefer spending holidays with friends or family?
samples.transcript: >> It actually depends on where we are going. For example, if we are heading to overseas, I would prefer going with my friend because my family members do not know English and I will have to worry about them and do the all the talking stuff. But if I am with my friends who actually know English very well, we can, you know, have a great time together. >> Mhm.
samples.transcript_original: >> It actually depends on where we are going. For example, if we are heading to overseas, I would prefer going with my friend because my family members do not know English and I will have to worry about them and do the all the talking stuff. But if I'm with my friends who actually know English very well, uh we can, you know, have a great time together. >> Mhm.

samples.question: >> Is your city or region a good place for other people to have a holiday in?
samples.transcript: >> For young people, yes. But I would not say so for older people. For young people, it is a great place to visit >> because there are a lot of entertainment facilities. There are a lot of parks, cinemas, shopping malls that you can visit. >> Okay.

samples.question: Any other regions or cities you would recommend to have holidays in?
